description.narrative: The lack of personal legal status means the lack of rights and dignified life. There are main 4 groups of people living in Thailand and having legal status problems including ethnic minorities with approximated number of 600,000 persons, migrants with 2.2 million persons, refugee with about 1, 200,000 people and stateless persons with about 1 million persons. These people are considered as inferior or second-class civilians and that they encounter rights problems, are vulnerable to different forms of exploitation such as forced or cheap labour, human trafficking. Thhis project aims to promote and protect the rights of migrants including those from refugee camps who are likely to become migrant labour after camps closed down to mitigate the risks from exploitation and human trafficking. Objectives are 1. Increase cross-border protection for migrants 2. Promote fair recruitment and employment practices and 3. Strengthen capacity among duty bearers and civil society actors in managing labour migration. Main expected results include 1. There are established youth networks in Thailand and cross-border between Thai-Myanmar 2. Availability of trainers who can provide on safe migration 3. Migrant labour are confident and follow the rules of law 4. Employers and government officials are well aware of rightful law enforcement 5. Improved attitudes towards migrants among the public 6.  Migrants have understanding about the related law and able to claim for their rights 7. The change of policy and laws that are beneficial for migrants 8. Improved situation of migrant treatment in the reports at both national and international levels. Main activities:  Group formation, training workshops, legal counselling centres, awareness campaign, collaboration with different stakeholders, human rights violation monitoring, policy advocacy.

This project mainly contributes to results within Democratic culture. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020. Results will be reported at earliest by June 2018
